byline.contributor: Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura contributed reporting from London, and Julfikar Ali Manik from Bhola, Bangladesh. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

abstract: Interviews and investigation reveal how ISIS members indoctrinated 'Alex,' 23-year-old woman from Washington State who was initiated into Islam and group's ideology; agents displayed sophisticated knowledge of social media, spending thousands of hours over six months courting Alex and teaching her about Islam; Alex cites her loneliness and isolation as factors; case gives deeper insight into why more than 100 Americans have traveled to join ISIS jihadists amid aggressive recruitment effort in West.
lead_paragraph: For months, Alex had been growing closer to a new group of friends online — the kindest she had ever had — who were teaching her what it meant to be a Muslim.

headline.main: ISIS and the Lonely Young American
